Now this is what I call caring about the people who fund these antics.... THE TAX PAYERS!!!
author: Kula M.

description: Thanks to you, I got nothing done in the classroom yesterday. My entire class of 2nd graders went apeshit every time you flew by, which was like, every 5 minutes. Thanks. Thanks a bunch.
author: Chantal H.

description:
always a delight. an awe-inspiring display of precision and death-defying moves. we're watching them fly and perform in the skies over san franloser, why talk about the size of the pilot's manhood ? could you weirdos possibly be penis-obsessed ? lacking some good loving ? puh-leaze, you haters. like I stated before (see Fleet Week review), these Men in the Armed Forces will protect and defend your sorry lame lefty pinko asses regardless of your feelings toward them. your dainty she-he girly man friends would scamper away and leave you to your own devices. in times of trouble give me a Navy man w/ a 3-inch pecker, you flower children can have the pacifist who's hung like a horse. it ain't always the package, dearies, it's what's in the heart.

wah wah wah wah wah wah, it's so noisy, my pussy is cowering in the corner. would you and kitty still hiss if the fighter jets above us were flown by north koreans or iranis ? leftists only like the noise of their own voices spewing anti-American sentiment.

boo hoo boo hoo boo hoo, all the gas they're wasting. I don't see any of your asses developing alternative fuel sources. try farting in the tank of your ugly little prius and see if it runs. get a group of your friends and blow farts into a muni bus, you might get free fast passes. and for my cyclist friends: you and your little bikes are indeed saving the world. haven't you noticed how fucking deserted Market St. is at 5:30 pm ?????? I don't see ONE car at all, I only see you guys pedaling happily on your pee wee herman rides

NEWSFLASH 10/6/06 -- Friday afternoon. the Angels flew overhead, as they did the day prior, engines roaring, giving me comfort that maybe America isn't so bad off. and today just as yesterday, my little Prima Dachshund looked up at the sky in awe. no whimpering, no whining, no sissy cowering for this pooch. when a 10-lb high-strung dog doesn't get spazzed out by the noise of fighter jets, why should a frickin human. my Lola's two cats were lazy daisy on the couch, no prob there either. liberals and their manufactured ailments. Jesus
author: Prima D.

description:
here's the science, check it: (dB = decibels)

60 dB  - Normal Conversation
70 dB  - Busy Street Traffic 
80 dB  - Vacuum Cleaner  
98 dB  - Large Orchestra  
100 dB - iPod at Maximum Level 
110 dB - Front Rows of Rock Concert 
130 dB - Threshold of Pain  
140 dB - Military Jet Takeoff    **(Your Blue Angels)**
160 dB - Instant Perforation of Eardrum

I've seen kids and babies in strollers, burst into tears as these "angels" flew overhead. Why? Because the sounds are waay over the threshold of pain. 

My sense of hearing plays a very important part of my work and play, so I wear my earplugs whenever they are flying around, as these sound levels (especially around children!!!) are simply criminal. You can't undo premature deafness ...nor perforation of the eardrum. 

My recommendation: fly higher and spare our ears!
author: I. O.

description: Please pay me a ton of money to come over to your house uninvited and bang some pots and pans in your ear... and then marvel at the precision that I did it with, and also at the size of my dick.
author: Bodacious T.

description: OK, I'll represent the tree-hugging pacifistic commie pinkos and give this ridiculous waste of taxpayer money and purveyor of noise pollution one star.
author: Andi T.

description: The Blue Angels are so awesome, it is simply beyond words.  We watched today from Treasure Island as they maneuvered and barrel-rolled me into a love affair with the US Navy.  I had been told to go to Crissy field or Coit tower to get the best view, but after reading a thread on Yelp, we went to Treasure Island.  And the poster was spot-on!  As I sat on the rocks and the Angels were approaching, I found myself instinctively ducking and covering because they were coming in so low.  The view from TI was incredible, and the noise was deafening and it was magical.  I could see them start over by GG park and Crissy field, then shoot over downtown SF, swing around TI and Angel Island and back again.  They did not leave a single spectator in any area of the bay out.  The Blue Angels rock!  I wonder if they take stowaways...?
author: K G.

description: I've loved them since I was a kid.  I really enjoyed the shock on the faces of the people I worked with from the east coast, on the 50th floor of the BofA Bldg. when they roared by during the week!  Fleet Week is a tradition I grew up with and have passed on to the mini mees.
author: Janet W.

description: Wow, how come so many of you are bitter Betty's about the Blue Angels? I mean they're pure entertainment, they get you outdoors and they bring some color into the city. I watched them two days in a row and was thoroughly thrilled and impressed. I sat on my roof with my mouth open watching them zoom in formation over and around my building. I even liked watching all the other San Fran dwellers watch the Angels on their roofs. It was kind of a bonding moment between my city and me. Plus they were far prettier to watch then the unfortunate-looking sailors all over town.
author: Sammy S.

description: You have to respect the intense training these guys do and how good they are in what they are doing. I have fond memories of taking my kids to see them up at Fleet week in SF and up in Seattle at Seafair.
author: Barb B.

description:
hmmm..
after reading the reviews.
i must admit...i was planning on taking my 2.5 year old to check out the 'cool blue jets doing tricks,' but i've changed my  mind.
i too agree that with our energy crisis, spending crisis, war crisis..etc..
why would i expose myself and  my child?
i'm not gonna lie..when i'm crossing the bridge and see them nose diving into the bay...i think it's kinda cool. but then i realize that i nearly rear ended someone b/c of it..
so never mind..
thanks yelp.
author: K K.

description: Theres nothing better than a display of military superiority roaring through the city to remind the unappreciative citizens why we are free.
author: Danny C.

description: I was a Navy brat and have always loved the Blue Angels. My dad taking us to the air shows at Moffett Field are some of my fondest childhood memories. Are they the gas guzzling propaganda wing for the Navy? Yes. I don't see a problem with them inspiring people to join the military and serve our country. I don't really watch the news I must have missed the part about them flying through San Francisco shooting Iraqi civilians. The military does not send itself to war. We need intelligent politicians making good decisions so that good people aren't dying for bad causes.
author: Jim D.

description: The Blue Angels are awesome.  I love to go to the Marina Green every year and watch them.  Yes, I agree with you that they are noisey, but who cares - they're awesome!
author: Joni M.

description: Never missed them....will be there to watch them again this weekend! Loud and furious, fly see them fly!
author: Yan M.

description:
Little known fact: the Blue Angels were originally called, "The Annoy Cats and Small Children Angels."  In fact, the mission of the Blue Angels is to train 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, spend countless days away from home and family to annoy the people they have sworn to protect against all enemies, foreign and domestic.  They spend months and years overseas, away from their families and loved ones, in some cases earning less than minimum wage, often in dangerous situations, just to have the chance, to one day, possibly annoy the cats and dogs of San Francisco.

There is no sought after position in the military more than the "Annoy San Francisco Cats and Dogs Angels."  In fact, the Marines who spent Christmas in Iraq and Afghanistan fighting an enemy that kills innocent civilians and beats women for wanting to learn and their Marine and Navy brothers in the sky, braving anti-aircraft missiles and artillery, were just training to come back to the States and fly missions in San Francisco to annoy cats and dogs.

It has nothing to do with providing the American people a glimpse of their military.  It has nothing to do with providing a little entertainment.  It has nothing to do with instilling pride in America and its strength and force.  Its sole purpose is to annoy the cats and dogs of San Francisco, to show a big dick and to wake people from their naps.

Next time, you or Billy Bragg may want to look upon those loud machines and think about the men and women, who fly, ride in, and maintain them.  Ponder the sacrifices they make in providing this nation with the warm blanket of freedom we all enjoy.  Maybe you might even imagine how much more disturbing it would be if you were not sure what country the planes were from, or whether they were going to attack your beautiful neighborhood.  But you shouldn't worry too much about that, because they will not let it happen.

The Blue Angels apologize for the noise... it is the sound of freedom.

No wonder why the rest of the country laughs at my hometown, San Francisco.

The people complain about the Blue Angels because it annoys their cats and dogs.  Well, so do fireworks on the Fourth of July, so does a police siren, so does thunder and lightning.  But, you know what?  I get the fuck over it.  And so does my dog.  And the poor bastard has a small dick and no balls (sorry Ike-my bad).

You can look at them as machines of war.  And, sure, machines of war fought off the Nazis during D-day, and fought the Japanese in the Pacific.  Wah Wah Wah, war is bad; So is tyranny.  And don't like the war in Iraq?  Fine.  We did end up fucking that one up.  But, don't sit in your air conditioned office drinking your non-fat latte and complain and lecture to the world about war.  You can hate war and the politicians who cause war, but the one week where this city faces the men and women who make sacrifices to ensure we are safe and that nobody will fuck with us, put all your ideology aside, and thank them for their service and for your freedom to be an asshole.  And don't make this into a "big dick, small dick, testosterone" thing- you just look bitter and stupid.

And I love the argument about wasting taxpayer money?  Seriously?  I wonder what the % of the Defense budget is spent on the Blue Angels.  San Franciscans lecturing about wasting taxpayers' money?  We spend taxpayer money on parades that celebrate all aspects of our society, from cultural parades to gay pride parades.  And we should, b/c it celebrates what makes this country great.  But, you really don't care about taxpayers money. Besides, the Blue Angels bring a lot of revenue into San Francisco, so that pretty much ruins that argument.  Don't like the traffic?  Now we will cancel everything in San Francisco that causes traffic problems.  There goes the Bay to Breakers, the Gay Pride Parade, and all the great festivals San Francisco has.

Oh, and if you do fall of a ladder b/c of the Blue Angels, your lawsuit will be laughed out of District Court.  And shattering your ear drum from the Blue Angels?  Are there a lot of San Franciscans falling off ladders and going deaf during Fleet Week?  Stop being bitter, some complaining about dick size, shave your legs, go outside, be thankful for the freedom you enjoy, drink a beer and enjoy the show.  Life is good if you let it be.  You may not like the war, but the people who serve in uniform do so with many sacrifices in dangerous situations that you couldn't even imagine.  Soldiers and Marines die on a daily basis trying to better a country that faced 30 years of oppression.  Sure, our politicians, both Democrats and Republicans, fucked it up, but when you see someone who signed the dotted line and took an oath to serve something more important than himself or herself, shut the fuck up, go up to him or her, shake his or her hand and say, "Thank you."  Then ask yourself what difference you have made in the lives of others...  I hope you can also say you did.
author: Michael W.

description:
true blue oxymoron...join the US Navy to fly the skies in a  $19.5 million plane and scare the crap out of sensitive dogs, cats and other living creatures. yes, waste another $50,000 in fuel for a show in one hour and create massive traffic tie ups on city streets.

the best year was 2001, the year of true air security. peace and quiet.
author: miriam b.

description: Get them the f--k outta here.  Send them to Fresno, San Diego, or Orange County.  When our kids were babies, they'd get woken up out of their afternoon naps by the strafing runs.  And our dog would flip out for the same reason.  Is there really a reason to spend taxpayer money (and to shamelessly burn so much jet fuel during an energy/climate change crisis) when there are so many other things that need federal funding?  And what about the needless potential for an accident right over the city, all for the sake of watching risky airplane manuevers?  I don't get it.
author: moosedog i.

description: I hate hate hate hate this time of year. I hate how every jackass has to stop dead in their tracks to look up when they fly by. I hate how they fly near the building I work in and make me think that I'm going to die a fiery fiery death. I hate it.
author: Jackie I.

description: No matter my personal opinion on the way the military is being run and deployed in Iraq and around the world, I still like Fleet Week, and I love watching the Blue Angels. I especially like it when they get so close you can see the yellow of their helmets.
author: Suepattra M.

description: It was a great show.. I was lucky enough to view the whole show from the Golden Gate Yatcht Club (I am in membership process) what a great club and what a great group of people...  Anyways... the show as always was perfect and as always brings a tear to my eye.
author: Robin G.

description: This was SO COOL yesterday and today! I live on McAllister and my balcony faces north toward Laurel Village and Pac Heights and I could perfectly see all the Blue Angels' flying routes *directly* in front of and above my house; it was like my own private little show from my balcony!  I will be sure to catch it next year.
author: Rick H.

description:
i hate fleet week, and i don't use that word often at all. 

* a disgusting display of militarism (a reminder of who's in charge).
* a disturbance to the peace (can't they at least keep it over the water?).
* a huge waste of taxes.
* a most unnecessary pollution to the air.

my nerves have trouble handling the continual screeching four days straight. i wonder how those who have actually felt war feel? (especially those who were victims, not just soldiers).

Call to file your complaint:
FAA Office (in Alameda) 650.599.5057
Mayor's Office 415.554.7111
Your Local Supervisor
http://www.sfgov.org/site/bdsupvrs_index.asp?id=93624

~
author: Jade P.

description: I love the adrenalin flowing like it does when this gifted group of daredevils scare the bejesus out of cats, dogsm car alarms and senior citizens.  There is a LOUD majesty to these shiny blue jets zooming, swooning and careening through the skies just feet over our bright blue skies at the speed of sound creating more sound than an erupting volcano at the head of my bed.  Precision, daring, blaring and blasting around and through our magnificent 7 square miles, reminding us that we're powerful and a protector to a world gone mad.  A relic of our imperial age, but totally wild.
author: Stu S.

description: The people that look forward to this every year are the same poeple that look forward to fireworks.  They are just looking for another excuse to get drunk and "ohh and ahh".  If you've seen that crap once, youve seen it a thousand times.  get a life.
author: Aric W.

description: Don't these guys have innocents and "insurgents" to kill while doing aerial tricks over a middle eastern country or three? I don't care about entertainment. I want my freedom, so get to work flyboys.
author: Jon F.

description: I am lucky enough to have a dad who is a retired SF PD!  Ever since I can remember we have gotten to hang out at a prime location to watch this! this year we were hanging out right where they were crossing. Ok I know they are loud (love that) that they buzz your flats and let some jet fuel go here and there- but c'mon how great is this. How cool is it to see these planes run thru our streets! 1 time a year i think you can handle that! GO BLUES!
author: Jennifer O.

description:
purrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrgggggggggggssssssssshhhhhhh

peeeeeeeeeeewwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww

Wiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiishhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

The sounds that make a young man aroused. 

Next year I will be on a boat in the bay...with my nose in the air.
author: Adam L.

description:
i love the blue angels i don't care what anyone else says.  i grew up here in the bay area and having them around every year and watching them practice in the days before fleet week was something i was awed by as a kid, something i look forward to now, and they add to the charm that is my home.  watching them from a boat in the bay is the best!

i'm a little saddened/whatever you want to call it that some people's negative reviews of these guys have absolutely nothing to do with the blue angels themselves.  if you can't take the noise that comes along with the events that happen here then move or shut up!  seriously; are you going to complain about the noise of an event that you actually like but it might be just as annoying to someone else?  didn't think so.  we live in a C I T Y remember?  there are three quarter million people living here.... bfd if you don't know how to use earplugs if you want to take a nap on a hot saturday afternoon when they fly over your house for five seconds just like they do every year.

the accuracy of the men flying those jets and their precision flight patterns never cease to amaze me.  watching them i could swear there are giant magnets that keep them so perfectly aligned.  i mean, come on people, a straight shot up until the plane's silhouette disappears and then a sudden spiral dive towards the ocean?!  hello?!  radness!  and then to top it all off they fly UNDERneath the golden gate AND remain in formation.  talk about being on the same wavelength.  and they do it all because we love them :)  or at least i do...
author: Ashleigh K.

description:
i dont know which way to go... extreme hate for the fact that the loud noise scares the crap out of me or extreme love for watching their aerial acrobatics from crissy field on a fabulous sunny saturday. 
i was sitting in an all glass conference room listening to someone super boring drone on about fraud when all of a sudden WHOOOSH BOOM!!! holy crap!!! wtf was that? everyone stops and looks at me while i grip the table as though my life depended on it. they all laugh "aly, its only the blue angels". yeah yeah. screw you guys. i'm getting out of this glass cage and moving into the inner sanctum of the building... but you know my ass is going to be out at crissy field completely amazed and in awe of the blue angels.
author: Aly L.

description: The kid in me loves them. The adult in me hates what they represent. Enough said.
author: Chris B.

description: Loud, fast, and skilled.  People who don't like the noise should ask what it is like living under the loudspeaker in a prison camp because they didn't have a military to protect them from the jerks of the world.  I know they need their mid-day weed naps, but for the rest of us, the Angels are well worth the trip to see them work.
author: Robert F.

description: Keep on flying.  I love it.  Louder the better.  I just wish they would buzz the code pink crowd.
author: mike p.

description: my first time to watch them and i plan to come back every year.  such a great show with all the tricks and loops and booms!  watched them over near ghirardhelli square.  my fave part was when they'd come from the city side and their jets would echo and scare the shit out of me and the rest of the crowd.  it was also a great time to people watch--you see all the different, beautiful people that make up the bay area!  i esp love the tandem bikes with the seats for babies and l'il rugrats!
author: Rinne R.

description: The single most annoying annual event that comes to SF. Shouldn't they be spending that money blowing up some foreign country or...gasp, using it to help people? I wish I worked for the government and could do a "Look at how much tax payer money I can waste!" event, I have some real ideas for that.
author: Colleen B.

description: Boo to wasted tax dollars, excessive noise, potential crashes, and a superficial attempt to incite patriotism.
author: Jenny K.

description: Is it a bird, is it a plane?! No, it's the Blue Angels! So cool what they do...how do they do what they do anyway- that's some scary maneuvers they got going on...very entertaining to watch that's for sure.....Blue Angels bring in the boys, so this is a win win situation people. Get some friends, get some beers in a bag and look up in the sky and your Sunday is complete. Can't wait for next year.
author: Ricquel N.

description: Wow, as biter as some people sound,..who doesn't love the rah rah & fun this brings out. Yea its a deadly tourist trap. But cruising the bay and seeing all the people out on their boats, on the piers, lining the bridge and hills during such a gorgeous day...there is nothing quite like it that brings out SF pride quite like this. I just watch everyone wave as we go bye and think how lucky we are to live in such a diverse & fun city. You can  look at it negatively or you can think, wow i live in such a beautiful city and only a handful of people ever get to see this. Love the stunts, love the sounds, even love their weekly practice. Plus its my bday weekend and what a fun way to celebrate!
author: Kai T.

description: I've NEVER seen/heard them before, but I heard it's amazing, and I know they started practicing, but can ANYONE tell me where and when the ACTUAL show is on Sat/Sun? I'm not from the Bay Area originally, and just moved here recently, so, any help would be MUCH appreciated!!
author: Jay S.

description: We had about 20 people show up for our picnic to watch the US Navy Blue Angels.  A wonderful patriotic time was had be all.  We flew the flag, took tons of pictures, and enjoyed a beautiful day.  As children of immigrant parents who made careers in the US Navy and US Army, who thrive in this wonderful country, are deeply proud to be part of this great American experiment.  By the way, the family has members of both political parties who attended and all are pro-US military.
author: Allan S.

description: It's funny that people complain about jet fuel from these planes are most likely driving to and from work everyday. Give it a break. This is an awesome show to reflect the skill of a few great individuals. It's a good time to get together with family, friends and neighbors.
author: Joanna W.

description: i looooove loud things! the louder the better.... and the blue angels are SO LOUD you can feel the buildings shake when they're flying by. i feel like a kid because i get so excited when they're in town and never miss the air show... and its a rush watching the jets race across the sky in perfect formation. this is definitely my favorite time of year.
author: Michelle I.

description: absolutely horrible, would give anything(except more of my tax dollars) for these guys to never return. burning thousands of gallons of jet fuel per hour. scaring old ladies, animals, and babies. interrupting conversations across the city every five minutes. not to mention that 26 people have died in crashes since they started doing shows. odds are that one day a blue angel will crash over the city... is it really worth it?
author: zachary p.

description: too noisy. too expensive. too military. too much flying over my office. too silly. and what's the point? can we use that money for something else?.
author: T O.

description: i just like the vibrations they send through solid objects I am sitting on.
author: Grace M.

description: I was smiling yesterday once I figured the wonderful S.F. fog curtailed the Blue Angel's performance..they only did a few cursory fly- bys and then it was silent. Today they seem to be in the air as they come screaming by every few minutes but it's even more overcast today. Safety concerns have been voiced for years over this event and, thank the Gods/Goddesses, nothing has happened so far. What really got me was the comments from disappointed, pissed-off people who 'drove for 45 minutes' and 'scrambled' to find seating for the show. The Blue Angels need three miles of visibility to perform their stunts. What? You want they should crash into each other or into buildings just to satisfy you disappointed onlookers? I say go to a NASCAR event..you're sure to see some spectacular crashed there! Oh, and I researched how much it cost to do one show...8000 gallons of JP5 fuel per plane at $1,378..that's six planes using up a total of about $8,200/per show. Dang! I bet their Chevron cards are steep at the end of the month! Oh, right, WE pay for that, right?  And don't get me started on the Columbus Day parade! Wonder how many Native American's are involved in this event? Crappy weekend.
author: michael s.

description: i,so love theese guys!! there so awesome!! there so cool and loud and they do so much for public service. their a joy to watch. thank you so much for the navy for giving us this show every year up here in western washington. i,love u guys!!
author: Seahawks F.

description: This show is awesome. Sadly, the politicians have removed the real fun of it, having them fly low across the City when starting the show. However, it's still a gem. Go USA! Down with the whiners!
author: T.J. K.

description: What is up with flying over the Financial district during the work day? What if one of these planes crashes into a building? Imagine the loss of life.
author: John M.
